intro: Hippolytia senecionis, commonly known as the yellow starbursts, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, oval-shaped leaves and has a compact, bushy growth habit. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
